shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Introduction - The “Synopsis of Classes” (fols. 2ra-2va) - Letter of Eusebius to Carpianus (fols. 2va-3rb) - Canon tables (fols. 4ra-7rb) II) Gospel of Matthew (fols. 7va-68ra) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Matthew: 68 titles (fols. 7va-8va) - Bǝsratä Matewos “Gospel of Matthew” (fols. 11ra-68ra) III) Gospel of Mark (fols. 68rb-106ra) - List of the “tituli” for the Gospel of Mark: 51 titles (fols. 68rb-68vb) - Bǝsratä Marqos “Gospel of Mark” (fols. 70ra-106ra) IV ) Gospel of Luke (fols. 106ra-170ra) - List of “tituli” for the Gospel of Luke: 84 titles (fols. 106ra-107va) - Bǝsratä Luqas “Gospel of Luke” (fols.108ra-170ra) V) Gospel of John (fols.170rb-218rb) - List of “tituli” for the Gospel of John: 19 titles (fol. 170rb) - Bǝsratä Yoḥannǝs “Gospel of John” (fols. 171ra-218rb)
Additiones 1-6.

donors.donor: Kǝflä Waḥǝd is mentioned as the donor in Additio 1; the silver covers were commissioned by däğğazmač (?) Täsfa Zälläläw.

dcomments.dcomment: Late 19th cent.(?) The Ms. is difficult for dating.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered by reddish-brown leather; textile (red) inlays; lavish metal (gilded silver?) covers. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Incised decorations on the (gilded?) silver covers. On the front cover; incised: The Holy Trinity, legend: ሰርግ (ጐ?) ዘማቸ ተስፋ ዘለለ || ውሥለስ (sic) ፡ ቅዱስ ፡ || ዝወንጀለ ፡ ዘወርቅ ፡ ዘቤተ ፡ ጰረቅሊጦስ ፡ ቀሲስ ፡ ዘምካኤል ፡ ገበረ (?) ፡ የተሰፋ ፡ ወልዱ ፡ ለመምህር ፡ ገብር ፡ ጰዮርግሰ (?) ፡ አኽሰም, “The ornament of zämačä (?) Täsfa Zälläläw. Holy Trinity. This is the Golden Gospel of the House of Ṗäräqliṭos qäsis Zä-Mikaʾel, worker of Täsfa (?), son of mämhǝr Gäbrä Giyorgis (?). Aksum” Flagellation of Christ, legend: ዘከመ፡ ኰርዕወ(sic) ፡ አይሁድ ፡ ለእግዘእነ(sic), “How the Jews smote Our Lord”; Crucifixion, legend: ዘበመ (sic) ፡ በከየት እግዝእ<ትነ>, “How Our Lady wept”; ዘከመ ፡ ሰቀለዎ ፡ አይሁድ ፡ ለእግዝ<እነ>, “How the Jews crucified Our Lord”; ቅዱስ ዮሐንስ (?), “Saint John (?)” On the back cover; incised: The Virgin and Child, legend: ቅዱስ ሚካኤ<ል>, “Saint Mikaʾel”; ምስለ ፍቀር (sic) ወልዳ, “with Her beloved Son”; St. George of Lydda: ቅዱስ ጊዮርጊስ, “Saint George”; ደራጎን “dragon” ʾabunä Zä-Mikaʾel ʾArägawi, legend: አቡነ አረጋዊ, “ʾabunä ʾArägawi”

squires.squire: I(10/fols. 1r-10v) – II(6/fols. 11r-16v) – III(8/fols. 17r-23v) – IV(8/fols. 24r-31v) – V(8/fols. 32r-39v) – VI(6/fols. 40r-45v) – VII(6/fols. 46r-51v) – VIII(8/fols. 52r-59v) – IX(6/fols. 60r-65v) – X(4/fols. 66r-69v) – XI(8/fols. 70r-77v) – XII(8/fols. 78r-85v) – XIII(8/fols. 86r-93v) – XIV(8/fols. 94r-101v) – XV(6/fols. 102r-107v) – XVI(6/fols. 108r-113v) – XVII(8/fols. 114r-121v) – XVIII(7/ s.l. 3, stub after 5/fols. 122r-128v) – XIX(8/fols. 129r-136v) – XX(8/fols. 137r-144v) – XXI(8/fols. 145r-152v) – XXII(8/fols. 153r-160v) – XXIII(8/fols. 161r-168v) – XXIV(2/fols. 169r-170v) – XXV(8/fols. 171r-178v) – XXVI(8/fols. 179r-186v) – XXVII(7/ s.l. 3, stub after 5/fols. 187r-193v) – XXIX(8/fols. 194r-201v) – XXX(6/fols. 202r-207v) – XXXI(8/fols. 208r-215v) – XXXII(4/fols. 216r-219v) – B(3/ s.l. 3, stub after 1/fols. 220r-222v)

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling. The ruling pattern is different for the canon tables.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; incipits and headings of the texts, numbers and incipits of the chapter; elements of the punctuation signs; Ethiopic numerals; notes written in the margins; crux ansata.

otherdetails.otherdetail:
The Ms. is the "Golden Gospel" of ʿAddäqaḥarsi Ṗaraqliṭos.
On fols.: 136 (At the daybreak the women come to the grave and find it empty.) and fol. 210 (Jesus dies on the cross.)

edition.text: R.COWLEY, "New Testament Introduction in the Andemta Commentary Tradition", Ostkirchliche Studien 26, 1977, 145-92.

literature.text: A. BAUSI, "Some short remarks on the Canon tables in Ethiopic manuscripts", Studi Magrebini, 26 (1998-2002 [2004]), 45-67. BauEr I–III. EAE I, "Canon tables". EAE II, "Eusebios of Caesarea". EAE II, "Gospel(s)". EAE II, "Gospel illustration". EAE III, "Wängelä Wärq". D. NOSNITSIN, “Historical Records from Ethiopia: A Trilingual Document from Asbi Däbrä Gännät Sellase, Tegray”, Studies of the Department of African Languages and Cultures 41, 2007, 17-47. PAWLOS SADWA, “Un manoscritto etiopico degli Evangeli”, RSE 11, 1952 [1953], 9-28. R. ZUURMOND, Novum Testamentum Aethiopice: the Synoptic Gospels, Part I: General Introduction, Part II: Edition of the Gospel of Mark Stuttgart 1989 (AeF 27), I, 7-31, 240-55.

Fols. 2ra-2va: The “Synopsis of Classes”

Fols. 2va-3rb: Letter of Eusebius to Carpianus

Fols. 4r-7r: Canon tables

desccontent.author: Ascribed to St. Matthew

edition.text: R. ZUURMOND, Novum Testamentum Aethiopice. III. The Gospel of Matthew, Wiesbaden 2001 (AeF 55).

literature.text: R. ZUURMOND, Novum Testamentum Aethiopice: the Synoptic Gospels, Part I: General Introduction, Part II: Edition of the Gospel of Mark, Stuttgart 1989 (AeF 27).

desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 11ra, l.1: Book of the birth of Jesus Christ, son of David, son of Abraham...
desccontent.details:
Fols. 7va-8va: List of the “Tituli” for the Gospel of Matthew – 58 titles

Fols. 11ra-68ra: Bəsratä Matewos “Gospel of Matthew”

The traditional opening lines to the Gospel are missing.

The traditional opening lines to the Gospel are missing.

desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 108ra, l.1: Because many started to tell and instruct about things that occurred among us…

desccontent.author: Ascribed to St. John

desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 171ra, l.1: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the word was God...
desccontent.details:
Fol. 170rb: List of “Tituli” for the Gospel of John – 19 titles

Fol. 171ra-218rb: Bəsratä Yoḥannəs “Gospel of John”

The traditional opening lines to the Gospel are missing.

additional.cont: Fol. 3v: Donation note, inventory of items donated by Kəflä Waḥəd.
additional.det: The note mentions Kǝflä Waḥǝd, the donor of the manuscript, who donated to the church also different other items, in the time of Mǝḥǝrkä Dǝngǝl (the head of the church?).

additional.cont: Fol. 8va-8vb: Regulations of the church of Ṗaraqliṭos, established in 1964.
Fol. 9ra-9rb: Regulations of the church of Ṗaraqliṭos, established in 1934-35.
Fols. 9va-10ra: Regulations concerning the gäbäz of the church of Ṗaraqliṭos, established on an assembly in 1951.

Fol. 69ra-69rb: Record concerning the land of the church of Ṗaraqliṭos during the time of King Mənilək II (r. 1889-1913), Metropolitan Ṗeṭros (in office 1881-1917) and governor ras Səbḥat (1844-1914).
Fol. 219ra-219rb: Record concerning a dispute, litigation, decision of the judges and reconciliation.

extras.extra: - Unreadable stamps: fols. 9r, 10r, 69r. - Record which was washed out: fol. 219rb.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Threads are inserted in the ruling pricks, in the margin of the folios.
